intro: Peucedanum minutifolium, commonly known as lesser cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
